alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:44PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wayne and southwestern McCreary Counties through 415 PM EST... At 344 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sunnybrook, or 12 miles east of Byrdstown, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mount Pisgah around 350 PM EST. Parmleysville and Burfield around 355 PM EST. Great Meadows Campsites, Griffin, Rockeybranch and Kidds Crossing around 400 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Co- Operative, Slavens, Blue Heron, Whitley City, Stearns, Pine Knot, Strunk and Marshes Siding. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central Kentucky.
